children.name: to like sb or st better than others
prefer
examples: thích hơn, ưa hơn
▪ Which bread do you prefer, brown or white?
▪ ‘Which restaurant shall we go to?’ ‘I really don’t mind. Whichever one you prefer.’
much prefer somebody/something
rất thích ai đó / cái gì
like something much better
▪ She doesn’t like romantic fiction -- she much prefers detective stories.
▪ Brad Pitt? Oh no, I much prefer Russell Crowe!
prefer somebody/something to somebody/ something
thích ai đó / cái gì để ai đó / cái gì
▪ I’m beginning to like Japanese food. I certainly prefer rice to potatoes.
I’d prefer something
tôi muốn một cái gì đó
▪ Dave wants to go to New York again, but I’d prefer somewhere more exotic.

children.name: like better
children.definition: /ˌlaɪk ˈbetəʳ/  especially spoken to like one person or thing more than another one:
examples: thích hơn
▪ Which do you like better, the red tie or the green one?
like better than
như thế tốt hơn
▪ I like our new teacher much better than the one we had before.
▪ There was nothing she liked better than being in the limelight in front of the press and TV cameras.

children.name: have a preference
children.definition: /hæv ə ˈprefərəns/  formal to prefer something - use this especially when you are discussing which one of several things should be chosen:
examples: có một sở thích
▪ We could eat Chinese, Indian, or Italian. Do you have any preference?
have a preference for
có một sở thích cho
▪ The new leader has a preference for people who come from the same area of the country as he does.
have no strong/particular preference
có không có sở thích mạnh/đặc biệt
you don’t prefer any of them more than the others
▪ I really have no particular preference -- you choose.
express a preference
nhận một sở thích
say that you prefer one rather than others
▪ When I asked her about where she wanted the meeting to be held she didn’t express any particular preference.

children.name: favour
children.definition: British /favorAmerican /ˈfeɪvəʳ/  if a person or group in a position of authority or influence favours something such as a plan, idea, or system, they think it is better than the others:

children.name: thiện ý, sự quý mến
examples: ▪ President Bush was known to favor the use of military force.
▪ In the 1930s the Bauhaus school tended to favour a technological approach to art.

children.name: give me sb/st any day!
children.definition: give me somebody/something any day! /ˌgɪv miː somebody/something ˈeni deɪ/ spoken informal used when you want to say that you strongly prefer one type of thing:

children.name: cho tôi ai đó / cái gì đó bất kỳ ngày nào
examples: ▪ I can’t stand English men -- they’re so boring. Give me an Italian any day!
▪ Forget all your salad and beans and organic food -- give me a thick juicy steak any day!

children.name: when one thing is preferred to another
hơn, thích hơn, ưa hơn
examples: ▪ Come early in the week -- on Monday preferably.
▪ We’re looking for well-qualified young people, preferably with good computer skills.

children.name: ▪ ‘And you need to get a can of beans.’ ‘Black or red?’ ‘Whichever they have. Preferably black.’
preferable
children.definition: /ˈprefərəbəl/  formal a choice, result, situation etc that is preferable is one that you would prefer:
examples: đáng thích hơn, đáng ưa hơn
▪ So we’re agreed. Our preferable course of action is to do nothing until the report is published.
▪ The most preferable arrangement would be for us to pay very low interest over a long period of time.
preferable to
thích hợp hơn để
▪ As far as I’m concerned anything would be preferable to staying here alone.

children.name: preferred
examples: được thích hơn, được ưa hơn
preferred method/option/course of action etc
các phương pháp/tùy chọn/khóa học vv ưa thích của hành động
the method, choice etc that you would prefer when there are several to choose from:
▪ The preferred method was to cut the grass early in the morning when it was still wet.
▪ Yes, that would be my preferred course of action.

children.name: to prefer to do one thing rather than another
prefer
children.definition: /prɪˈfɜːʳ/  if someone prefers to do something, they like doing it better than something else:
examples: thích hơn, ưa hơn
prefer to do something
muốn làm một cái gì đó
▪ French people usually prefer to buy goods that are made in France.
▪ Most of my friends take the bus to school, but I prefer to walk.
prefer doing something
thích làm cái gì
▪ Mark likes lying on the beach, but I prefer visiting museums.
prefer doing something to doing something
thích làm một cái gì đó để làm một cái gì đó
▪ She seems to prefer watching soap operas to talking to me.

children.name: would rather do st
children.definition: would rather do something/wʊd ˌrɑːðəʳ ˈduː something ǁ-ˈræ-/  especially spoken if youwould rather do something, you want to do it more than another thing you could do instead, or more than what you are doing now:
examples: thay vào đó sẽ làm một cái gì đó
▪ I’d rather wear my Reeboks if we’re going to be walking around all day.
would rather do something than do something
thay vào đó sẽ làm một cái gì đó hơn làm một cái gì đó
▪ A significant group of young men would rather go to jail than join the army.
would much rather do something
muốn làm cái gì nhiều thay vì làm một cái gì đó
▪ ‘Do you want to stay for supper?’ ‘I’d much rather go home, if you don’t mind.’
would rather somebody did something
thích ai đó làm một cái gì đó
especially British
▪ I’d rather we went skiing this year instead of hiking.

children.name: would prefer to do st
children.definition: would prefer to do something/wʊd prɪˌfɜːʳ tə ˈduː something/  if youwould prefer to do something, you want to do it more than another thing you could do instead, or more than what you are doing now:
examples: muốn làm một cái gì
▪ Any smart employer would prefer to hire an experienced worker over an unknown.
▪ We would both prefer to live in the north of England, but there aren’t many jobs there.
would prefer somebody to do something
muốn ai đó làm cái gì đó
▪ I’d prefer them to come next weekend rather than the one after.

children.name: would sooner do st
children.definition: would sooner do something/wʊd ˌsuːnəʳ ˈduː something/  if youwould soonerdo something, you would very much prefer to do it especially instead of something else that you dislike or that is unpleasant:

children.name: sẽ sớm làm một cái gì đó
examples: ▪ Marry him? I’d sooner die!
▪ He’s the kind of person who’d sooner help people than make money out of them.
